array.string: Today I walked along the dunes of the Curonian Spit, which splits the Curonian Lagoon from the Baltic Sea.
Yesterday I journeyed to The Hill of Crosses.
I can't believe I just went scubadiving in the lakes of Zarazai.
Yesterday I saw a boat race in Lake Galvė in Trakai.
I toured the Gediminas Castle Tower today.
Can you believe I got to ride a hot-air balloon over Vilnius last night?
My friend tells me that this country was the last European country to adopt Christianity.
I hear this country is also called 'The Land of Storks.'
My friend says that it's bad luck to whistle indoors because it's believed to call in the 'evil little devils.'
Isn't it incredible that I'm where Santa Clause lives?!
I hear that I'm in the country that drinks the most coffee worldwide!
I can't believe I'm in the most sparesely population country within the European Union!
My friend says this country is also nicknamed 'Land of Midnight Sun.'
This country sure has a lot of lakes.
I'm so ecstatic to be traveling where the creators of Angry Birds were born!
Did you know there are no public payphones here? I'm glad I haven't lost my phone yet!
Today I visited the Temppeliaukio Church. I can't believe it is built directly into the rock!
Yesterday I went to the most relaxing sauna. Now I know why this country is famous for them!
I can't believe the Rubik's cube was invented here!
I hear this country is known for its natural hot springs.
Today I took a swim in Lake Balaton.
Last night I tried gulyás for the first time!
Yesterday I arrived at the 'Paris of the East.'
I took a wonderful cruise down the Danube River this evening. This city is so beautiful at night.
I went shopping at the Ecseri Flea Market today.
Today I walked up to the summit of Gellért Hill.
During the summer, I hear there's a huge musical event called the Sziget Festival. I hope I can go this year!
My friend says this country is the least populated country in the European Union.
Today I visited Amazon's headquarters!
I hear this country is a well-known tax haven.
I can't believe I'm in one of the smallest countries in the world!
I'm in the the only Grand Duchy in the world!
Yesterday I visited Europe’s largest television and radio company!
I'm in the richest country in Europe!
Last night I took a tour of Château de Vianden.
Today I went to see the Bock promontory and I walked through its vast underground system of passages.
I just visited Cricova, the largest underground wine cellar in the world.
I almost forgot to exchange my euros for leu at the airport!
Yesterday I went swimming in Chisinau Lake.
Today I biked around Chisinau.
Last night I saw a play at the Chekhov Drama Theatre!
My friends and I drove up north to see the Soroca Fortress today!
I took a boat river tour along the Nistru River today!
I toured the Saharna Monastery today.
I went shopping at the art market on Bul. Stefan Cel Mare yesterday!
I just rode one of the world’s deepest subways! So many stairs!
I just celebrated Maslenitsa with some friends! I ate many pancakes.
Saint Basil's Cathedral really glows at night.
Today I visited the Kremlin. It only cost 700 ruble!
I tried black bread at dinner yesterday and it was delicious.
Last night I drank my first kvass at Cafe Pushkin!
It's freezing here! I hope you are staying warm.
I saw a ballet at the Bolshoi. It was quite beautiful.
I visited TSUM today. It's the biggest mall I've ever seen!
I'm visiting one of the oldest countries in Europe!
I can't believe the inventor of the first computer was born here!
Did you know the national instrument here is the bagpipes?
Today I went to the world's largest IMAX 3D cinema.
I'm where Spartacus was born!
Yesterday I went hiking in the Rila Mountains.
Last night I got lost in Plovdiv's narrow cobbled streets and quaint houses.
I just went swimming in the Black Sea. Isn't that exciting?
Last night I went to a mineral water spa. It was very relaxing.
Yesterday I ate this dessert with a crackling top. It was very delicious!
Everyone here wears these cute little chef hats. I really do like them a lot.
I'm just sitting here with a glass of wine in the Jardin des Tuileries.
I visited Euro Disney today. It was quite fun. I think you would have enjoyed it too.
I took an evening cruise on the Seine. It was incredibly romantic.
Today I saw the Mona Lisa. I'll admit, I did get a bit teary-eyed.
I just had the most amazing sugar crêpe in the Latin Corner.
Earlier today I visited the coziest bookstore, Shakespeare and Company. So many books!
This afternoon I went shopping on Avenue des Champs-Elysées. There were so many designer shops!
I took a tour of the Tower of London today.
I got to ride the Eye last night! The city is gorgeous from above.
I took a trip out to Stonehenge today. The experience was very magestic.
Today I saw the changing of the guards outside the palace!
I took a train into Kings Cross last night.
Yesterday I took the Warner Bros. Studio Tour. I saw all of the costumes and props from the Harry Potter films!
Today I got to see the expensive jewels inside Westminster Abbey.
I can't believe I'm walking in Shakespeare's hometown.
I've been riding the Tube all around the city this week.
Did you know over half of the world's cork is produced here?
I drove across the longest bridge in Europe today!
Yesterday I bought a book from Bertrand, the oldest bookstore in the world!
Last night I walked around the cork forests and olive groves of Alentejo.
I just took a toboggan ride down to Funchal, Maderia!
My friends and I drove down to Cape St. Vincent to catch a stunning sunset over the ocean.
Today I jumped on a tiny boat to explore Ponta da Piedade. The place had such a majestic aura with its large rock formations and colorful waters.
I just toured one of the largest aquariums in the world!
I visited The Mouth of Hell today! It was humbling to watch the roaring waves crash against the rocks.
I had to exchange my Euros for Hryvnia at the airport.
I just had the amazing soup called borsch.
I can't believe I'm in the second biggest country in Europe!
I hear that Ivana Kupala Day is a blast!
Today I traveled through this leafy pathway called the Tunnel of Love.
Did you know the world's heaviest aircraft was made here?
Yesterday I visited the National Chornobyl Museum.
I took a trip to catch a glimpse of the Black Sea today.
Today I got lost adventuring around Lviv.
This place is almost entirely surrounded by mountains.
I just visted the oldest university in Eastern Europe!
I can't believe Ivana Trump was born here!
I hear this place is the castle capital of the world.
Today I visited The City of 100 Spires.
Yesterday I crossed The Charles Bridge. Did you know it's over six hundred years old?
I hear this country is known for its animated and puppet films.
Last night tried knedliky, which are also known as dumplings. They was so yummy!
I'm where Franz Kafka was born!
My friend tells me that this country was the first to use online voting.
I can't believe there is free public transportation here!
Today I visited the Parnu, the summer capital of this country.
Isn't it incredible that half of this country is covered by forests?!
Yesterday I went kiiking for the first time. I strapped into what looked like a swing, but it circled all the way around.
I took a tour of Lahemaa National Park today.
Did you know the light switches here are usually at waist level?
There are over than 1,500 offshore islands here!
I went to Tallinn Botanical Garden today!
My friend says this country has the most enthusiastic radio listeners in Europe!
I heard that bullfighting has been a popular sport here for thousands of years.
Today I traveled to the largest salt lake in Europe!
I just went hiking in the Pyrenees!
Yesterday I explored the Gate of the Sun plaza. Did you know it is in the geographical center of this country?
My friend claims Coca Cola was invented here, but I don't believe him.
I just spent the day exploring La Rambla. I love how the street is lined with blooming green trees.
Last night I walked around the 'City of Three Cultures.'
I saw a fútbol game at Camp Nou today!
Today I visited Mount Olympus. My friend says it's the home of the Gods!
My friend says shipping is an important industry here.
Did you know the official name of this country is the Hellenic Republic?
I'm in one of the most mountainous countries in Europe!
I can't believe I'm where the Olympic Games originated!
Did you know that voting is required by law here?
I walked around the Parthenon today!
Yesterday I visited the Acropolis Museum.
I sat in the Epidaurus Theater today. Can you believe it?!
My friend says there isn't a McDonald's anywhere in this country!
I'm where Mother Teresa's ancestors were born. Can you believe it?
Today I visited Kruja Castle. It was once the center of Skanderbeg’s battle against the Ottoman Turks.
Yesterday I visited an archeological site called Butrint. It used to be a Roman city in Epirus!
I spent a very relaxing weekend at Mt Dajti National Park.
I walked along the beaches of the Ionian Coast today.
Here, my friend says shaking your head side-to-side means yes and shaking your head up-and-down means no.
For the most part, people use furgons to get around this country.
I just went shopping at the treg.
I can't believe I'm in the place that inspired Bram Stoker's 'Dracula.'
I'm where the fountain pen was invented!
Today I visited The Black Church. Can you believe it has the largest organ in Europe?!
My friend says this country has ten 'sister' cities in the United States.
Yesterday I saw the tallest rock sculpture in Europe!
I just took a tour of the Palace of the Parliament, the second largest civilian building in the world!
I just visited the Mineralogical Collection of Brad, the only Gold Museum in Europe!
I went to see the Peleș Castle today.
Today I saw the Sphinx in Bucegi Natural Park!
My friend tells me there are no snakes here. Isn't that strange?
I traveled to the Aran Islands today.
I kissed the Blarney Stone yesterday! Isn't that crazy?
Last night I took a cruise on the River Shannon.
Today I went to the Galway Arts Festival. So many talented people!
This place has such a fantastic pub scene.
I'm in the place where Halloween was born!
I can't believe the Titanic ship was made here.
I got to visit the Guinness Storehouse today. Did you know it has seven floors?!
Did you know this country is home to Europe's widest waterfall?
I hear this country is famous for its amber.
Today I drove out to the coast to catch a glimpse of the Baltic Sea.
Yesterday I went birdwatching in Pape.
I went hiking in Gauja National Park today!
Today I went kayaking on the Gauja River. It was a blast!
In the spring, I hear there is a festival called Night of the Museums. I really want to go sometime!
Last night I took a tour of Turaida Castle.
I just tried Sorrel soup for the first time!
My friend says this place is one of the most biologically diverse countries in the world!
Today I visited Postojna Cave. Did you know it has a network of passages that is over 20 km long?
Yesterday I explored Triglav National Park. It's one of the oldest parks in Europe!
I toured Bled Castle on Bled Lake today. Did you know it dates back to the eleventh century?
Last night I saw an oepra at the Slovene National Theatre.
I visited the Old Vine House in Maribor today. I can't believe it houses the oldest wine vine in the world!
My friends and I ate lunch in an open air market in Ljubljana yesterday.
I heard you can sleep in a prison cell at the Celica Hostel!
I can't believe I just went rafting on the Soca River. It was quite an adventure!
Today I visited the ancient city of Troy!
I can't believe I'm in a city that's built on two continents!
Yesterday I saw the world's oldest tin mine in Göltepe!
This place is incredible. I can't believe Homer and King Midas were born here.
Last night I went to see the Sultan Ahmed Mosque.
I went shopping in The Grand Bazzar today.
I went to the world's oldest known human settlement today!
My friend says this country is known for its intricate carpets and rugs.
I visited the Hagia Sophia Museum yesterday.
Today I visited Djerdap Gorge, Europe's largest gorge!
My friend says this country is the largest raspberry exporter worldwide!
I can't believe Constantine the Great was born here!
My friends and I walked around Silver Lake today. It has the bluest water I've ever seen!
Last night I had cevappi for dinner. As you know, I'm a meatlover so I thought it was delicious!
I went to The Cathedral of Saint Sava today. Did you know it is the largest Orthodox church currently in use?
The Niš Fortress looks so beautiful at night.
I can't believe I went bungee jumping at Ada Ciganlija today!
Today I explored Nikola Pašić square.
Today I saw the world's largest emerald in the Imperial Treasury of the Hofburg!
Yesterday I visited the oldest zoological garden in the world!
I can't believe I'm where Arnold Schwarzenegger grew up!
I hear celebrity chef Wolfgang Puck was born here.
I got to see some of Europe's tallest waterfalls today!
Last night I visited Schoenbrunn Palace.
Yesterday I went hiking in Lech Zürs.
Today I visited Red Bull's Headquarters!
I tried Viennese Coffee for the first time today.
I hear this country ranks amongst the most liveable on Earth!
Today I visited Vinnufossen, Europe's highest waterfall!
Last night I drove through the world’s longest road tunnel!
I can't believe the cheese slicer was invented here!
My friend says skiing was invented here.
Last night I traveled to the Lofoten Islands to see the northern lights.
Yesterday I went to the very famous hot chocolate factory, Freia! Did you know it was the inspiration for the book 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory?'
I visited Viking Ship Museum today.
Yesterday I took a tour of Akershus Castle.
I can't believe one of the Kings of Madagascar is from here!
Yesterday I spent a very relaxing evening in Piestany Spa City.
I hear this country has over 2,400 caves!
Today I hiked from from Strbske pleso to Skok waterfalls in High Tatras.
Last night I tried Lokse for the first time and it was fantastic!
I can't believe I just took a tour of Bojnice Castle!
Today I climbed up to the UFO Observation Deck in Bratislava.
I hear this place is known for their castles.
Last night I walked around Hviezdoslav Square.
Yesterday I visited the largest Christian edifice in the world!
I just went to world's first true pizzeria, Antica Pizzeria Port’Alba.
This country is home to the world's oldest film festival!
Last night I tossed a coin into the Trevi Fountain.
Today I got to walk the streets of Pompeii.
Yesterday I took a tour of the Flavian Amphitheatre.
I can't believe I saw Michelangelo's David today!
I rode a gondola through all of the city's canals last night!
I can't believe I'm walking around in Leonardo Da Vinci's hometown.
I can't believe I am where the microscope and telescope were invented!
Today I walked through the largest flower garden in the world!
I tried french fries dipped in mayonnaise today. It was very yummy!
I'm in the bicycle capital of the world!
I bought my first pair of wooden klompens today.
The tallest people in the world live where I am!
Yesterday I visited Van Gogh Museum.
There are so many windmill here!
I hear everyone wears orange here on holidays.
There are four official national languages here!
I hear this country is known for its long tradition of watchmaking.
I can't believe the Red Cross Society originated here.
I'm in a place that is famous for neutrality in the World Wars.
Did you know where I am is also known as the Confoederatio Helvetica?
I hear chocolate is this country's main export.
Last night I visited the world's largest particle physics laboratory, CERN!
Yesterday I saw the largest church clock face in Europe!
Today I skied down the Matterhorn. It was a blast!
I'm where the necktie was invented!
Today I visited Hum, the world's smallest town!
Yesterday I biked along the Dalmatian Coast.
Alfred Hitchcock says this country is home to the best sunset in the world.
I traveled to 'The Pearl of the Adriatic' today.
I can't believe Marco Polo was born here!
Last night I walked on the longest fortification walls in Europe!
Did you know the largest white truffle was found here? My friend apparently thinks so.
I just went to windsurfing at Zlatni Rat. Its beach extends like a tongue into the sea!
I'm in the most populated country of Europe!
Today I visited the largest zoo in the world, Zoologischer Garten.
I can't believe I got to go to the Fairy Grottoes. They were the most colorful caves I have ever seen!
I'm where Beethoven was born!
My friend tells me this country was the first to adopt Daylight Saving Time.
Yesterday I visited the oldest sun observatory in Europe!
Last night I went to Ulm Cathedral, the tallest church in the world!
I just went shopping in the largest department store in continental Europe!
I hear this country is where the cuckoo clock was invented!
I walked across Stari Most today. The view of the town from the bridge was absolutely breathtaking!
Today I went swimming by the Kravice Waterfalls.
Yesterday I visited the Tunnel Museum in Sarajevo.
My friend says this country is nicknamed 'Heart Shaped Land.'
I almost forgot to exchange my dollars for markas at the hotel!
I heard this country hosted the 1984 Winter Olympic Games.
Today I visited the last remaining jungle in Europe!
Did you know births and weddings are still accompanied by celebratory gunfire here?
Last night I visited Vrelo Bosne, a spring located south of Sarajevo.
I heard this country's name translates to 'Black Mountain.'
Today I walked along the beaches of the Adriatic Sea.
Last night my friends and I explored Perast.
Yesterday I visited Our Lady of the Rock. Did you know the monastery is located on its own island?
I went swimming in the Bay of Kotor today.
My friends and I drove up Mt Lovcen to go to the Njegos Mausoleum. The view of mountains was incredible!
I visited the Ostrog Monastery today. I can't believe it's built directly into the mountain!
I just went kayaking on Lake Skadar!
I saw the clock tower in Herceg Novi today!
I hear that this country has the largest households in the European Union.
I can't believe I'm where Frédéric Chopin was born!
Today I visited the oldest restaurant in Europe, Piwnica Swidnicka!
Yesterday I tried pierogi for the first time and they were very yummy!
Last night I went on an adventure in Krakow. My friend tells me it's often referred to as 'the next Prague.'
I took a tour through the Wieliczka Salt Mines today.
I can't believe I just walked through sand dunes in Słowiński National Park!
I bought Oscypek cheese from a market vendor yesterday. I love its intricate shape!
Today I walked through Zaplipie's painted cottages. Now I know why it's called the painted village!
Sadly, there's no ocean to go to here because this country is landlocked.
I can't believe I'm where Mother Theresa of Calcutta was born!
I hear this country has the more mountains than any other country in the world!
My friends tell me this country has two flags!
Today I saw the Millennium Cross, the biggest cross in the world!
Yesterday I visited the Church of Sveti Jovan in Kaneo. I can't believe it was built over eight hundred years ago.
I visited the Tvrdina Kale Fortress last night. The view of the city is absolutely breathtaking from up there.
I just finished shopping at the Old Bazaar in Skopje.
Today my friends and I explored the stone pathways around Matka canyon.
Today I drank Birch sap for the first time. It was very delicious!
Last night I saw a play at Vol'naya Stsena.
Yesterday I took a tour of Mir Castle Complex.
I visited the Chagall Museum today. It had many of Chagall's lithographs and several representations of the tweleve tribes of Israel.
I saw a hockey game at the Minsk-Arena last night.
I just toured the oldest wildlife reserve in Europe!
My friend tells me that this country is known for its skillful glassblowing.
I hear this country hosts the Slavyansky Bazar Arts Festival during the summer.
Today my friends and I had an adventurous day at Gorky Park.
Here, the motorway system is visible from the moon!
Did you know the world's tallest man lives here? This country is incredible.
I went to the Malmedy carnival today!
Yesterday I visited the world's diamond capital, Antwerp!
Last night, I went to the 'Pearl of the Ardennes.' It was incredibly luxurious!
The chocolate here is as good as they say.
I bought a delicious gaufre de liege from a street vendor today.
This country has three official languages!
Today, I visited the Atomium and it has the most beautiful view over the city.
I can't believe I'm where IKEA was founded!
Today I visited Europe's largest shopping mall!
My friend tells me that Skype and Spotify were founded here!
Last night I got to stay at the Ice Hotel. It was absolutely breathtaking.
I really enjoyed seeing the ships inside the Vasa Museum today.
Tonight I'm traveling to the 'Venice of the North!'
Tomorrow I'm taking a Stromma boat tour.
Yesterday I went to the Liseberg Amusement Park. It was a blast!
Today I took a trip down to the Bothnian Coast.
I'm at the place where Lego's were created! It's that amazing?!
I love the open-faced rye-bread sandwiches here!
I just saw a Little Mermaid statue in Copenhagen!
I went to Tivoli Gardens last night. It was just like a fairytale.
I just took a boat around the Jutland peninsula! How cool is that!
Last night I went on the rainbow rooftop at ARoS Art Museum.
Today I got lost in the mazes of Labyrinthia!
Nyhavn is beautiful! I love all of its the colorful buildings.
I had a picnic in King's Garden this afternoon. It was quite peaceful.
